  "title": "Mechanical / Industrial Engineer",
  "description": "Lavita Group is a fast-growing and innovative organization dedicated to excellence in service delivery and sustainable growth. We operate across multiple sectors, providing top-quality solutions that meet global standards. Our team is driven by integrity, innovation, and a passion for excellence.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mechanical / Industrial Engineer
Job Locations:&nbsp;Lagos &amp; Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	We are seeking a results-driven Mechanical/Industrial Maintenance Engineer with strong expertise in automobile systems, industrial processes, and fuel conversion technologies.
	The ideal candidate will provide management-level technical leadership, driving innovation, system redesign, and technology adoption.
	This role involves collaborating with management to enhance operational efficiency, support business growth, and ensure continuous improvement across mechanical and industrial operations.


Key Responsibilities
Technical &amp; Engineering Leadership:


	Provide expert technical guidance on automobile and mechanical systems design, optimization, and integration.
	Exhibit strong knowledge of all systems related to vehicles, including internal combustion engines, fuel systems, and alternative energy technologies.
	Support management in evaluating and implementing new technologies for system redesign, process efficiency, and cost reduction.
	Develop strategies for the adoption and redesign of technologies, including assembly processes, system improvements, and sustainable mobility solutions.


Industrial Maintenance &amp; Process Management:


	Oversee and improve mechanical and industrial maintenance processes to ensure equipment reliability and operational uptime.
	Design, implement, and manage preventive and predictive maintenance systems.
	Provide support services and technical direction for end users and field operations.
	Ensure all maintenance activities align with quality, safety, and compliance standards.


Research, Development &amp; Innovation:


	Collaborate with management and R&amp;D teams to drive innovation in fuel conversion, assembly systems, and industrial processes.
	Recommend and help implement technological advancements and best practices in mechanical and industrial systems.
	Monitor industry trends in automotive, energy efficiency, and industrial technology integration.


Training, Team Development &amp; Strategy Support:


	Train, mentor, and upskill technical staff and operators.
	Participate in management meetings to contribute ideas for sales expansion, technical promotions, and operational strategy.
	Support strategic planning through engineering insights, technical feasibility assessments, and innovation-driven solutions.
	Collaborate cross-functionally to support organizational goals in production, quality, and business growth.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Maintenance Engineering, Automotive Engineering, or Industrial Engineering.
	Minimum of 5&ndash;7 years of relevant experience in mechanical systems, industrial maintenance, or engineering management.
	Professional certification or membership (e.g., COREN, NSE, SAE) is an advantage.
	Strong knowledge of mechanical design, industrial systems maintenance, and automotive engineering principles.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, SolidWorks, and maintenance management tools.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Deep understanding of automotive systems, industrial processes, and maintenance management.
	Excellent analytical, diagnostic, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong project management and leadership abilities.
	Sound understanding of technology adoption, redesign, and assembly processes.
	Effective communication and teamwork skills with the ability to engage both technical and management teams.
	Ability to train others, brainstorm innovative ideas, and contribute to business expansion strategies.
	High attention to detail, accuracy, and adherence to quality and safety standards.


Remuneration


	Salary: N200,000 - N350,000 Monthly.
	Competitive and commensurate with qualifications and experience.


What We Offer


	Opportunity to work in a growing, multi-sectoral organization.
	Exposure to modern engineering and clean energy technologies.
	Supportive and innovative work environment.
	Competitive remuneration and benefits package.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;workforce.sm@247kpg.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Mechanical / Industrial Maintenance Engineer&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.

  "title": "Core Network and VAS Manager",
  "description": "Lebara Nigeria -&nbsp;Beyond top-tier telecommunications, we have forged strategic partnerships to offer financial services designed to empower the creative industry. Through microloans, device funding, Lebara powered internet hubs, and culture-shaping events to boost the art, culture, tourism and creative economy. we are committed to driving innovation, inclusion, and economic growth.

We are&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Core Network and VAS Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Type: Full-time
Department:&nbsp;Network Operations
Reports To:&nbsp;Head of Network and IT Operations

Role Summary


	The Core Network Manager is responsible for the planning, deployment, configuration, operation, and maintenance of the MVNO&rsquo;s core network elements, ensuring seamless service delivery to subscribers.
	This includes EPC, IMS, Diameter routing, signaling, interconnect, and integration with the host MNO&rsquo;s infrastructure.
	Responsible for the planning, deployment, integration, and lifecycle management of all Value-Added Services in the MVNO network.
	This includes SMSC, MMSC, USSD, voicemail, IVR, CRBT, mobile apps, and digital service platforms.
	The role ensures high network availability, capacity optimization, and compliance with regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities
Network Operations &amp; Maintenance:


	Manage and maintain EPC (MME, SGW, PGW), IMS, and HSS/UDM platforms.
	Oversee Diameter routing, signaling gateways, and IP routing infrastructure.
	Monitor network KPIs and proactively address performance issues.


Integration &amp; Interconnect:


	Manage interconnect links with the host MNO and roaming partners.
	Ensure seamless integration of MVNO services with the MNO&rsquo;s core network.


Capacity &amp; Planning:


	Forecast capacity needs based on subscriber growth and usage trends.
	Plan and implement hardware and software upgrades.


Security &amp; Compliance:


	Ensure network security with firewalls, SEPP, and encryption.
	Maintain compliance with local telecom regulations and lawful intercept requirements.


Incident &amp; Problem Management:


	Lead incident resolution and root cause analysis for network faults.
	Coordinate with NOC, IT, and vendor support teams for issue resolution.


Vendor &amp; Project Management:


	Manage relationships with core network equipment vendors.
	Oversee deployment projects and software updates.


KPIs &amp; Performance Metrics


	Core network availability (%)
	Mean Time to Repair (MTTR)
	KPI compliance with SLA targets
	Successful completion of upgrades/projects on time and within budget.


Qualifications


	Education:&nbsp;Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Telecommunications, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, or related field.
	Experience:&nbsp;Minimum of 10 years in mobile core network operations (EPC, IMS, HSS/HLR).


Technical Knowledge:


	EPC (MME, SGW, PGW), IMS, Diameter, HSS/UDM.
	Signaling protocols: SS7, Diameter, SIP.
	IP networking: IPv4/IPv6, BGP, OSPF, MPLS.
	Security: Firewalls, SEPP, VPNs.
	Deep understanding of SMSC, MMSC, USSD gateways, IVR, CRBT, voicemail platforms.
	Familiarity with APIs, content delivery platforms, OTT integration, and mobile apps.
	Knowledge of signaling protocols (SMPP, SIP, MAP, Diameter, HTTP APIs).
	Certifications (Preferred):&nbsp;Cisco CCNP/CCIE, Nokia, Ericsson, Huawei core certifications.
	Strong troubleshooting, analytical, and documentation skills.





Application Closing Date
Not Specified.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;youbelong@lebara.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.&nbsp;&nbsp;",

Facility Manager Job at Equity Specialist Hospital




        
    

        
        Equity Specialist Hospital is a modern medical facility in Lagos, Nigeria, committed to providing world-class, patient-centered care. Backed by Equity Health Group, the hospital offers advanced diagnostic and therapeutic services across key specialties, using cutting-edge medical technology. Its mission is to make high-quality healthcare accessible locally while reducing medical tourism.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Overview

Key Responsibilities


	Manage daily facility operations, including maintenance, repairs, and utilities.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations.
	Supervise facility staff and coordinate with external service providers.
	Oversee preventive maintenance schedules and emergency response readiness.

	Bachelor’s degree in Facility Management, Engineering, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in a hospital or healthcare facility.
	Strong knowledge of building systems, safety standards, and regulatory compliance.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
